alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 4:39AM CDT until July 11 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Oklahoma, including the following counties, Caddo and Comanche. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 439 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Apache, northern Lake Ellsworth and Boone. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
